experiments.warning1: Experiments are unreleased Discord features. They might not work, or even break your client or get your account disabled.
experiments.warning2: Only use experiments if you know what you're doing. Equicord is not responsible for any damage caused by enabling experiments. If you don't know what an experiment does, ignore it. Do not ask us what experiments do either, we probably don't know.
experiments.warning3: No, you cannot use server-side features like checking the "Send to Client" box.

fakeNitro.description: Allows you to send fake emojis/stickers, use nitro themes, and stream in nitro quality
fakeNitro.emojiNotice: This is a FakeNitro emoji and renders like a real emoji only for you. Appears as a link to non-plugin users.

noAttachmentPerms.body: You cannot send this message because it contains an animated FakeNitro sticker, and you do not have permissions to attach files in the current channel. Please remove the sticker to proceed.

noEmbedPerms.body1: You are trying to send/edit a message that contains a FakeNitro emoji or sticker,
noEmbedPerms.body2: however you do not have permissions to embed links in the current channel.
noEmbedPerms.body3: Are you sure you want to send this message? Your FakeNitro items will appear as a link only.
noEmbedPerms.disableNotice: You can disable this notice in the plugin settings.

settings.disableEmbedPermissionCheck: Whether to disable the embed permission check when sending fake emojis and stickers
settings.emojiSize: Size of the emojis when sending
settings.enableEmojiBypass: Allows sending fake emojis (also bypasses missing permission to use custom emojis)
settings.enableStickerBypass: Allows sending fake stickers (also bypasses missing permission to use stickers)
settings.hyperLinkText: What text the hyperlink should use. {{NAME}} will be replaced with the emoji/sticker name.
settings.stickerSize: Size of the stickers when sending
settings.transformCompoundSentence: Whether to transform fake stickers and emojis in compound sentences (sentences with more content than just the fake emoji or sticker link)
settings.transformEmojis: Whether to transform fake emojis into real ones
settings.transformStickers: Whether to transform fake stickers into real ones
settings.useEmojiHyperLinks: Whether to use hyperlinks when sending fake emojis
settings.useStickerHyperLinks: Whether to use hyperlinks when sending fake stickers

fakeNitro.stickerNotice: This is a FakeNitro sticker and renders like a real sticker only for you. Appears as a link to non-plugin users.

settings.title: Configuraciones

transparent.description: Make the Discord window transparent. A theme that supports transparency is required or this will do nothing.
transparent.note: This will stop the window from being resizable.
transparent.noteWindows: This will stop the window from being resizable and prevents you from snapping the window to screen edges
transparent.title: Activar transparencia de ventana

useQuickCss.description: Load custom CSS from the QuickCSS editor. This allows you to customize Discord's appearance with your own styles.
useQuickCss.title: Habilitar CSS personalizado

winCtrlQ.description: Add Ctrl+Q as a keyboard shortcut to close Discord. This provides an alternative to Alt+F4 for quickly closing the application.
winCtrlQ.title: Register Ctrl+Q as shortcut to close Discord

winNativeTitleBar.description: Replace Discord's custom title bar with the standard Windows title bar. This may improve compatibility with some window management tools.
winNativeTitleBar.title: Usar la barra de t√≠tulo nativa de Windows en lugar de la personalizada de Discord

settingsSync.imported: Ajustes importados exitosamente. ¬°Reinicie para aplicar los cambios!

showConnections.description: Show connected accounts in user popouts

showHiddenChannels.cannotSeeMessages: You can not see the {type} of this channel.
showHiddenChannels.requireTag: Posts on this forum require a tag to be set.
showHiddenChannels.seeGuidelines: However you may see its guidelines:

showMeYourName.modalDescription: Set a custom SMYN nickname for this user. Make use of it by specifying {custom} in the SMYN template settings.

settings.animateGradients: For the non-primary names, if the role has a gradient, animate it. This is disabled by "Ignore Gradients" and reduced motion.
settings.customNameColor: The color to use for the custom name you assigned a user if it's not the first displayed. Leave blank for default. Accepts hex(a), rgb(a), or hsl(a) input. Use "Role" to follow the user's top role color. Use "Role+-#" to adjust the brightness by that percentage (ex: "Role+15")
settings.discriminators: Append discriminators to usernames for bots. Discriminators were deprecated for users, but are still used for bots. By default, a bot's username is equivalent to a user's global name, therefore multiple bots can have the same username. Appending discriminators makes them unique again.
settings.displayNameColor: The color to use for the display name if it's not the first displayed. Leave blank for default. Accepts hex(a), rgb(a), or hsl(a) input. Use "Role" to follow the user's top role color. Use "Role+-#" to adjust the brightness by that percentage (ex: "Role+15")
settings.friendNameColor: The color to use for a friend's nickname if it's not the first displayed. Leave blank for default. Accepts hex(a), rgb(a), or hsl(a) input. Use "Role" to follow the user's top role color. Use "Role+-#" to adjust the brightness by that percentage (ex: "Role+15")
settings.hideDefaultAtSign: Hide the default "@" symbol before the name in mentions and replies. Only applied if either feature is enabled.
settings.ignoreFonts: For the non-primary names, use Discord's default fonts regardless of the user's custom nitro font.
settings.ignoreGradients: For the non-primary names, if the role has a gradient, ignore it in favor of the color set below.
settings.includedNames: The order to display usernames, display names, nicknames, friend names, and custom names. Use the following placeholders: {user}, {display}, {nick}, {friend}, {custom}. You can provide multiple name options to use as fallbacks if one is unavailable by separating them with commas as such: {custom, friend, nick}. You can have up to three prefixes and three suffixes per name.
settings.memberList: Display the first available name listed in your custom name format in the member list.
settings.mentions: Display custom name format in mentions.
settings.messages: Display custom name format in messages.
settings.nameSeparator: The separator to use between names. The default is a single space.
settings.nicknameColor: The color to use for the nickname if it's not the first displayed. Leave blank for default. Accepts hex(a), rgb(a), or hsl(a) input. Use "Role" to follow the user's top role color. Use "Role+-#" to adjust the brightness by that percentage (ex: "Role+15")
settings.profilePopout: Display the first available name listed in your custom name format in profile popouts.
settings.reactions: Display the first available name listed in your custom name format in reaction tooltips, and the full name in reaction popouts.
settings.removeDuplicates: If any of the names are equivalent, remove them, leaving only the unique names.
settings.replies: Display custom name format in replies.
settings.truncateAllNamesWithStreamerMode: Truncate all names, not just usernames, while in Streamer Mode.
settings.usernameColor: The color to use for the username if it's not the first displayed. Leave blank for default. Accepts hex(a), rgb(a), or hsl(a) input. Use "Role" to follow the user's top role color. Use "Role+-#" to adjust the brightness by that percentage (ex: "Role+15")
settings.voiceChannels: Display the first available name listed in your custom name format in voice channels.

showTimeoutDuration.description: Shows how much longer a user's timeout will last, either in the timeout icon tooltip or next to it
showTimeoutDuration.displayStyleDescription: How to display the timeout duration

silentMessageToggle.description: Adds a button to the chat bar to toggle sending a silent message.

settings.autoDisable: Automatically disable the silent message toggle again after sending one
settings.persistState: How to persist the silent message toggle state

command.chatBarIndicatorsOption: Hide other users' typing indicators from above the chat bar.
command.chatContextMenuOption: Show a dropdown in the chat context menu to toggle plugin settings on the go.
command.chatIconOption: Show an icon in the chat bar for toggling the plugin on the go.
command.defaultHiddenOption: Whether to hide typing in DMs/channels/guilds by default or not.
command.description: Hide your typing indicator from chat.
command.membersListIndicatorsOption: Hide other users' typing indicators from the members list.
command.toggleOption: Toggle functionality globally, for the channel, or for the guild.

silentTyping.noChanges: No changes made to silent typing settings.

settings.chatContextMenu: Show a dropdown in the chat context menu to modify plugin settings on the go.
settings.chatIcon: Show an icon in the chat bar for modifying the plugin on the go.
settings.chatIconLeftClickAction: What to do when left clicking the chat icon.
settings.chatIconMiddleClickAction: What to do when middle clicking the chat icon.
settings.chatIconRightClickAction: What to do when right clicking the chat icon.
settings.defaultHidden: If enabled, the plugin will hide your typing from others in any DMs/channels/guilds not listed in "Disabled Locations" below. If disabled, the plugin will show your typing to others for any DMs/channels/guilds not listed in "Enabled Locations" below.
settings.disabledLocations: Disable functionality for these IDs. Accepts a comma separated list of DM IDs, channel IDs, and guild IDs. Only used if "Default Hidden" is enabled.
settings.enabledGlobally: Toggle functionality of your own typing indicator globally.
settings.enabledLocations: Enable functionality for these IDs. Accepts a comma separated list of DM IDs, channel IDs, and guild IDs. Only used if "Default Hidden" is disabled.
settings.hideChatBoxTypingIndicators: Hide other users' typing indicators from above the chat bar.
settings.hideMembersListTypingIndicators: Hide other users' typing indicators from the members list.

sortFriendRequests.description: Sorts friend requests by date of receipt

textReplace.scope.myMessages: Apply to your messages (visible to everyone)
textReplace.scope.othersMessages: Apply to others' messages (only visible to you)

autoTranslateEnabled.body: You just enabled Auto Translate! Any message <0>will automatically be translated</0> before being sent.
autoTranslateEnabled.title: Equicord Auto-Translate Enabled

typingIndicator.description: Adds an indicator if someone is typing on a channel.

settings.includeBlockedUsers: Whether to show the typing indicator for blocked users.
settings.includeCurrentChannel: Whether to show the typing indicator for the currently selected channel
settings.includeIgnoredUsers: Whether to show the typing indicator for ignored users.
settings.includeMutedChannels: Whether to show the typing indicator for muted channels.
settings.indicatorMode: How should the indicator be displayed?

typingTweaks.description: Show avatars and role colours in the typing indicator

settings.alternativeFormatting: Show a more useful message when several users are typing
settings.amITyping: Shows you if other people can see you typing
settings.showAvatars: Show avatars in the typing indicator
settings.showRoleColors: Show role colors in the typing indicator

unsuppressEmbeds.description: Allows you to unsuppress embeds in messages

userVoiceShow.cannotJoinChannel: You cannot join the user's Voice Channel
userVoiceShow.description: Shows an indicator when a user is in a Voice Channel

settings.showInMemberList: Show a user's Voice Channel indicator in the member and DMs list
settings.showInMessages: Show a user's Voice Channel indicator in messages
settings.showInUserProfileModal: Show a user's Voice Channel indicator in their profile next to the name

usrbg.description: Displays user banners from USRBG, allowing anyone to get a banner without Nitro

settings.nitroFirst: Banner to use if both Nitro and USRBG banners are present
settings.voiceBackground: Use USRBG banners as voice chat backgrounds

vcNarrator.customiseMessages: You can customise the spoken messages below. You can disable specific messages by setting them to nothing
vcNarrator.description: Announces when users join, leave, or move voice channels via narrator
vcNarrator.linuxVoicesHelp: Install speech-dispatcher or espeak and run Discord with the --enable-speech-dispatcher flag
vcNarrator.noEnglishVoices: You don't have any English voices installed, so the narrator might sound weird
vcNarrator.osVoicesHelp: Try installing some in the Narrator settings of your Operating System
vcNarrator.placeholdersHelp: The special placeholders <0>{{USER}}</0>, <1>{{DISPLAY_NAME}}</1>, <2>{{NICKNAME}}</2> and <3>{{CHANNEL}}</3> will be replaced with the user's name (nothing if it's yourself), the user's display name, the user's nickname on current server and the channel's name respectively

settings.latinOnly: Strip non latin characters from names before saying them

vcNarrator.speechSynthesisNotSupported: SpeechSynthesis not supported or no Narrator voices found. Thus, this plugin will not work. Check my Settings for more info

viewIcons.description: Makes avatars and banners in user profiles clickable, adds View Icon/Banner entries in the user, server and group channel context menu.

settings.formatDescription: Choose the image format to use for non animated images. Animated images will always use .gif

viewRaw.copyRawLeftViewRawRight: Copy Raw (Left Click) / View Raw (Right Click)
viewRaw.description: Copy and view the raw content/data of any message, channel or guild

settings.clickMethodDescription: Change the button to view the raw content/data of any message.
settings.leftClick: Left Click to view the raw content.
settings.rightClick: Right click to view the raw content.

viewRaw.viewRawLeftCopyRawRight: View Raw (Left Click) / Copy Raw (Right Click)

voiceDownload.description: Adds a download to voice messages. (Opens a new browser tab)

voiceMessages.failedToParse: Failed to parse selected audio file: {error}
voiceMessages.iosFix: To fix it, first convert it to OggOpus, for example using the <0>convertio web converter</0>
voiceMessages.iosWarning: Voice Messages have to be OggOpus to be playable on iOS. This file is <0>{type}</0> so it will not be playable on iOS.
voiceMessages.sending: Now sending voice message... Please be patient

xsOverlay.description: Forwards discord notifications to XSOverlay, for easy viewing in VR
xsOverlay.preferUDPDescription: Enable if you use an older build of XSOverlay unable to connect through websockets. This setting is ignored on web.
xsOverlay.testNotification: This is a test notification! explode
